results.title: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.

results.title: The Care behind the smile
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Suzanne Baker, Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Dental therapists are badly needed in schools to ensure bad tooth decay does not develop amongst children. The film tells of the Australia-wide dental therapist training scheme, which will provide dental therapists for schools.

results.title: The Canadians
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film traces Canada’s evolution, and the contributions of people at home and from many lands including Yousuf Karsh, Lester B. Pearson and Dr. Wilder Penfield. It explores the country from coast to coast and to the farthest reaches of the Arctic, bringing to the screen lively impressions of this second largest country in the world.

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Angelica Mesiti, Bridget Ikin, Jodie Passmore and Felix Media
results.credit_line:
Angelica Mesiti
Three channel video installation, digital video, sound, 35:36 mins.
Ian Potter Moving Image Commission, ACMI Collection
Courtesy the artist and Anna Schwartz Gallery
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, three channel video, projection, colour and audio.
results.brief_description:
‘The Calling’ is a three-channel video installation that focuses on whistling languages, ancient forms of non-verbal communication which are still used in 2013 to communicate in isolated and difficult landscapes.

To conduct research for ‘The Calling’, artist Angelica Mesiti travelled to the village of Kuskoy in Northern Turkey, the island of La Gomera in The Canary Islands and the Island of Evia in Greece where whistling languages are all still in use.

For these communities, whistling languages are in a process of transformation from their traditional use as tools for communication across vast lands into tourist attractions and cultural artefacts and are being taught to local school children.

‘The Calling’ is a poignant exploration of ancient human traditions evolving and adapting to the modern world. The work speaks to the tenacity and creativity of traditional cultures in the face of globalisation, technological progress and environmental flux.

Angelica Mesiti was the winner of the inaugural Ian Potter Moving Image Commission.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Angelica Mesiti, Bridget Ikin, Jodie Passmore and Felix Media

results.title: The Camel boy
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In Australia’s early days the ship of the desert, the camel, was imported to help explore the harsh interior of this vast continent. Through the wonder of animation and live action ‘The Camel Boy’ takes you back to the beginning of this century for an exciting adventure story based on the actual journeys of explorers in Australia’s outback wilderness. The burning sands of the inland desert and the hurricane lashed waters of the ocean are the setting for this story of friendship between a boy and a camel.

results.title: The Caleche driver
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Much of the old-world charm of Quebec city can be accredited to the open, horse-drawn carriages in which visitors may explore the city - and to the drivers of these ancient vehicles. In this film we get to know Onesime Lamothe, veteran trooper of Quebec’s historic avenues and ever-ready fountain of knowledge.

results.title: Living Legacy : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight very different people tell of how Legacy came into their lives, the bonds they formed, the support of Legacy and how Legacy has remained with them throughout their lives.
